title: Mathematics Teacher Professional Development Program for Enhancing Student-Centered E-Learning Design Competencies: Focused on Equations, Graphs, and Statistical Modeling

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in basic e-learning tools, secondary-level math education experience (algebra, geometry, probability & statistics), understanding of math problem-solving strategies, and basic statistical analysis skills
context.additional_context: Educational course focusing on smartphone-based learning activity design and asynchronous collaboration. Emphasizes digital resources (virtual manipulatives, interactive graphs, probability simulations) for math concepts. Includes personalized education strategies through learning data analysis and measuring educational effectiveness (statistical significance verification).

learning_goals: Apply six student-centered e-learning design principles based on mathematics curriculum (e.g., equation visualization, graph interpretation, probability modeling) to develop educational scenarios for algebra, geometry, and statistics concepts.

Perform collaborative design processes with peer teachers following DBR (Design-Based Research) methodology, derive customized strategies for math concepts through learning data analysis, and establish a proof-based feedback system.

Learners analyze biweekly (twice weekly) math problem-solving results (equations, functions, statistics) using smartphone-based formative assessment tools (e.g., Kahoot!, Quizizz), identify ≥3 concepts with ≥20% reduced error rates, and create personalized learning plans to improve formula application and graph interpretation skills.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
